title: For anyone who's interested...
content:
I've been meaning to get an account on here for years [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oldy.gif[/img] , and have finally done it.

But that's not it.

After months of planning (and doodling), I have finally started on a CK comic book! It's black and white unfortunately, cuz i don't have time to colour it all in, but methinks the art is okay. Have gotten to about five or so pages now, but will have to wait until i can upload the cover or a page or 2. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

title: Re: For anyone who's interested...
content:
Welcome! New Keen art is always great.

If you email what you've got so far to jimage AT gmail D0T com, I can upload it for you.

title: New!
content: Welcome to the PCKF. Lookin' forward to the art!

title: And Now for the Cover!
content:
Here is the cover...
I may further edit it, but for now this is all you're getting! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img] lol[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] [img noborder][url=http://ck]ck[/url] comic[/img]

I got the idea for the title from the Spider-Man comic book 'Peter Parker Spider-Man'. Methought it was good so i called this 'Billy Blaze Commander Keen'

Cool eh?
Hope to get some more pages up here tomorrow or day after, so...

QED--------

content:
Yeah, the SGA does spell out stuff, you'll just have to figure it out urself. As to 'coherent', i just put the messages there for fun, there's gonna be a load more.

okaaaaaaay then, will leave GBC out. I've never played it before, so from what you're all telling me, it's like [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img]

He probably looks Dragon-Ball-like cuz i had trouble designing him so he didn't look like a teenager or an adult (which is the way i usually draw people), trying to make him look 8 was kinda difficult. Oh, he's actually ten in this one, set two years after AAMB.

Yeah, how do you think i should portray Omni-Speak? I was just gonna do it with SGA, but really...no idea!

title: Re: hehe
content:
hey sloths, just a technical problem--keen wears his wristwatch on his right wrist; it's in my sig [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

hey btw, ur sga style brings up a question. I notice u make the S character as a slash, when others make it like '-. that sorta. Similar with your C. I never draw it that way, but what does everyone think? is that how it was meant to be? I kinda don't think so cuz of the SGA paper on Tom's wall, but on the other hand, i always draw the D with a slanted line instead of _---------
Keen wears his watch on his RIGHT wrist... Is he left handed? Nope, he shoots with his right hand too.

"Dear Mother, I can't believe what happened today! I met one of the smartest people in the whole Universe! His IQ is three f...
Hold on, Mother. Something strange is happening...
6234yuweyudfhjgfklgmm,/.,"

title: Re: hehe
content:
No, he aint wearing shoulderpads, yet another flaw in the design i had with trying to make him look younger (dagnabbit!)

Yeah, forgot he wore his wristwatch on his right arm. Trouble is, i've already drawn 20 or so pages with it on his left, so i'll something like it gets knocked off his arm and he puts it back on again on his right. Something like that.

Yeah, i was thinking of having a big boss in one part later on. My idea was going to be either Mangling Machine II or a totally new Robo Red. I thought of Robo Red, cuz when i first played Keen 5 when i was little i got completely freaked when i first saw robo red. I still get a kick out of trying to beat the unbeatable bot now.

-------

KEEN: I'm Commander Keen! Defender of the Universe! Dispensing Galactic Justice with and Iron Fist!

MCMIRE: ...I'm Mortimer McMire...that's it...

title: Re: hehe
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]It's not in very good shape anymore (thanks to thisstrife going down and the Web Archive not backing everything up), but TMST's Chasm of Strife was great back in the day.

Man, has his art and animation improved since then.[hr][/quote]I saw some sites mention that when I was doing a search for other CK comics (I'm trying to link to as many as I can find off my site... including this one). Thanks for the link, but you're right, half the stuff is missing. Curses!

[url=http://bagshotrow.deviantart.com/]This guy[/url] over at deviant art also started a comic called "Shadowlands" (look in his gallery), but I'm not sure where the first page is.

[quote]Quote:[hr]No, he aint wearing shoulderpads, yet another flaw in the design i had with trying to make him look younger (dagnabbit!)[hr][/quote]If youre concerned about it, my suggestion would be to just drop his shoulders. IE, instead of making the shoulders a strait line across, angle them down slightly. So that if you draw a line from the middle of the neck to one shoulder joint, then the next shoulder joint, then back to the neck, it forms a triangle (when the character is facing forward). Just something to experiment with to see if it works with your style.

[quote]Quote:[hr]hey sloths, just a technical problem--keen wears his wristwatch on his right wrist; it's in my sig[hr][/quote][quote]Quote:[hr]
Yeah, forgot he wore his wristwatch on his right arm. Trouble is, i've already drawn 20 or so pages with it on his left, so i'll something like it gets knocked off his arm and he puts it back on again on his right. Something like that.[hr][/quote]Maybe he's ambidexterous and just wears it on whatever wrist he feels like on a particular day... Or maybe since he's older he one day in the past realized that you're supposed to wear it on your opposite hand... Or maybe that's not the real Keen but in fact an imperfect clone ... [edit: truncated [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img] ]

title: Re: hehe
content:
speaking of 'clones', u remember that Keen Cameo in Bio Menace? With the Four hanging Keens? I really like that scene, so i want to put it into the comic somehow, but can't put it in in a way that does it or the story justice.

The 4 Hanging Keens: One of them is the original, the others are not...One is a clone mixed with McMire DNA...the second is completely insane...the third has no memory of ever being Commander Keen...the fourth has no memory of ever being Billy Blaze.

I like the idea a lot, but like i said i can't do it justice with the present story!

And Another thing! Since Billy's grandfather is the main guy in Wolfenstein, i was thinking of getting a Wolfenstein creature in the comic, y'know, just to shake things up. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

-------

KEEN: I'm Commander Keen! Defender of the Universe! Dispensing Galactic Justice with an Iron Fist!

MCMIRE: ...I'm Mortimer McMire...that's it...

title: Re: hehe
content:
[hr]Mort01 Maybe he's ambidexterous and just wears it on whatever wrist he feels like on a particular day...
[hr]I was just about to suggest that. It seems very likely, since a high level of intelligence pretty much calls for such hemispheric integration.

I used to wear my watch on the right wrist, even though I'm right handed. At some point I decided I'd try the left wrist, but it didn't make much difference.

Nowadays I don't bother to wear a watch. Though I might if I find one that has Pong on it...

title: Re: hehe
content:
While I can't comment too much on the story so far at this early stage of it. I think the art is well drawn, but-- with the slightly darker tone of the story the art doesn't really fit. To me it's too simplistic, I believe for a more complex story the art should reflect it.

I suggest an art style more akin to the more of the superhero comics (spider-man for instance) or some of the Archie Sonic comics around issues #70-80 (before they got anime-ish and before Ron Lim took over), some of the noted artists are Steven Butler and J Axer (though Axer didn't come till later).

If that's too much, mostly what I am getting at is more detail, so I gave those examples in case you need more examples of more detailed art.

If you like your art the way it is, I'm just throwing out some suggestions of what *might* make it better. The important thing is for you to follow your own artistic ideas. Either way I think the comic will only get better. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: hehe
content:
I wear watch on my right hand and I'm right handed. I also use knife and work on the opposite hands I should.

Edit: Almost forgot... Great new drawings again. I like how the story is a bit darker than what we usually see, good work. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Also, nice signature Sloths!3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

But yeah, ure right, the art should compliment the plot and all that, so i'll see what i can do, it just might be a bit wierd having the comic art in one style for one half, then suddenly switching to another.
Hopefully will get some more pages up here tomorrow, and we get to see an alliance between three alien races uniting under one banner against two common foes: Commander Keen and The Grand Intellect!

title: Re: hehe
content:
Yeah good point...if you feel you should "upgrade" the art but it would seem weird with the different styles. My suggestion would be to wait till this section of story is done to make a transition, like if those pages you're working on is one issue, min-series, full series, etc.

But don't feel pressured to do an upgrade, I think that an art upgrade *might* help, but not necessarily. I'm just showing a possible route.

Most importantly is that you do what you feel is best. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: hehe
content:
Actually, I love the art so far (except for the beefy Keen). You have a very professional style. I'm just not so fond of the story. IMKO, it just doesn't fit the Keen universe, and Keen seems a bit high-strung.

It's interesting nonetheless, and I would definitely suggest seeing a section of the story through before making too many changes in style.

One thing I would suggest is containing things a bit less. Everything seems to be spilling out of the frames you're trying to enclose it in. This comic needs to breathe.
